note.text: In Pakistan, elders are highly respected and are often seen as authority figures. Itâ€™s important to show the same kind of respect to Pakistani elders as you would show to someone in a high-ranking position.

When speaking to an older person or to someone in a higher-ranking position, don't address them by their first name. Doing so may be taken as disrespectful. Try to avoid prolonged eye contact and use a more respectful style of speaking than you might with someone your own age.
In meetings, if possible, greet senior counterparts before you greet younger counterparts.
